intro: Barrosoa candolleana, commonly known as the Candolleana barrosoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Barrosoa candolleana is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
